description:
"ACCA" is a giant unified syndicate residing in a kingdom split into 13 autonomous regions. ACCA was formed back when there was threat of a coup d'etat, and it has continued to protect the peace of civilians for almost one hundred years. Jean Otus, the vice-chairman of the inspections department at ACCA headquarters, is one of the most cunning men in the syndicate's history with the nickname "Jean the Cigarette Peddler." Whimsically puffing his cigarettes, he wanders through the 13 districts, checking to see if there is any foul play afoot.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Royal Affairs
tags.description: Features nobility, alliances, arranged marriage, succession disputes, religious orders and other elements of royal politics.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Economics
tags.description: Centers around the field of economics.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Photography
tags.description: Centers around the use of cameras to capture photos.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Office Lady
tags.description: Prominently features a female office worker or OL.

node.description: Originating from [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/). Went through [Gonzo](https://anilist.co/studio/3/) and [Shin-Ei](https://anilist.co/studio/247/) before going freelance. He is most known for his work on the first season of [One Punch Man](https://anilist.co/anime/21087/OnePunch-Man/). He is also the original creator of original anime [Sonny Boy](https://anilist.co/anime/132126/Sonny-Boy/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yoshi_kawajiri) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B7%9D%E5%B0%BB%E5%96%84%E6%98%AD) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoshiaki_Kawajiri)

Yoshiaki Kawajiri is an esteemed director and general anime creator.

After he graduated from high school in 1968, he worked as an animator at [Mushi Production](https://anilist.co/studio/68/) until it closed. He then founded [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) together with fellow former Mushi Pro employees, [Masao Maruyama](https://anilist.co/staff/103170/), [Osamu Dezaki](https://anilist.co/staff/100393/) and [Rintarou](https://anilist.co/staff/102305/). At Madhouse, he debuted as a director on 1984's [Lensman](https://anilist.co/anime/2770/), albeit still jointly with the more experienced [Kazunori Hirokawa](https://anilist.co/staff/170070/). Kawajiri made his full-fledged directorial debuts in 1987, with [Wicked City](https://anilist.co/anime/1107/) and Running Man, the latter being a short film a part of an anthology collection, [Neo Tokyo](https://anilist.co/anime/1951/). Wicked City was originally meant to be a short film as well, but the producers were impressed enough in Kawajiri to let him turn it into a feature-length film. After these, Kawajiri directed [the third installment](https://anilist.co/anime/2998/) of Madhouse's adaptations of the highly acclaimed [Osamu Tezuka](https://anilist.co/staff/96938/) manga series, [Phoenix](https://anilist.co/manga/31325/).

Wicked City received critical and commercial success upon its release, giving Kawajiri more creative freedom. As a result of this he began writing the script for his own original film, [Ninja Scroll](https://anilist.co/anime/617/), a movie set in feudal Japan following a mercenary swordsman battling a team of ninjas with supernatural powers who are intent on overthrowing the Tokugawa shogunate. After the movie's international release, Kawajiri's status as a director received global recognition and he went on to direct multiple other works in the late '90s and early '00s.

In recent years, Kawajiri has taken a step back from directing, but has been guest appearing as a storyboard artist all over the industry.

Originating from [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/). Went through [Gonzo](https://anilist.co/studio/3/) and [Shin-Ei](https://anilist.co/studio/247/) before going freelance. He is most known for his work on the first season of [One Punch Man](https://anilist.co/anime/21087/OnePunch-Man/). He is also the original creator of original anime [Sonny Boy](https://anilist.co/anime/132126/Sonny-Boy/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/huusun)

Originating from Xebec. Although now is freelancer, currently engaged in training young directors for [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/) as of May 2024. Debuted as a director on [Wonder Egg Priority](https://anilist.co/anime/124845/).

He is most known for his work on the first season of [One Punch Man](https://anilist.co/anime/21087/OnePunch-Man/). He is also the original creator of original anime [Sonny Boy](https://anilist.co/anime/132126/Sonny-Boy/).
